alert.note: Alert for Fairfield; New Haven (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 16 at 8:53AM EDT until July 17 at 12:10PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Housatonic River At Stevenson Dam. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 11.5 feet, Water reaches the Maples area of Shelton. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 AM EDT Sunday the stage was 9.4 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage late this morning to 12.7 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage to 10.6 feet tomorrow morning. It will rise to 10.7 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall to 10.4 feet Tuesday evening. It will rise to 10.5 feet early Wednesday morning. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.7 feet on 05/17/1989. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Housatonic River Stevenson Dam Flood Stage: 11.0 Observed Stage at Sun 8 am: 9.4 Forecast: Sun 2 pm 12.7 Sun 8 pm 12.0 Mon 2 am 11.9 Mon 8 am 10.6 Mon 2 pm 10.7 Mon 8 pm 10.6 Tue 2 am 10.6 Tue 8 am 10.5 Tue 2 pm 10.4 Tue 8 pm 10.4 Wed 2 am 10.5 &&
